intro: Corchorus tortipes, commonly known as the woolly knotweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, bristly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish, clustered in dense inflorescences. Corchorus tortipes is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and roadside areas.
